On a failed save the creatures Strength score reduces by 1. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or Long Rest.

reaction.name: Misty Movemen
entries: When Alyssia is hit with an Attack, she can use her reaction to move up to her movement speed. After this movement Alyssia can't be farther away from the attacker than she was before it.
Special Actions

reaction.name: Calling the Swarm
entries: When Alyssia rolls initiative she can summon 2 {@Creature Vampire Bats|BMHS|Vampire Bats} within 30 feet of her. The Bats act right after Alyssias turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Jungle' Spellcasting ability is Wisdom (Spell save {@dc 18}). The Jungle can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Sentinels Tracking
entries: The Jungle has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell while tracking outsiders.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The Jungle can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Jungle makes up to 5 thorn whip attacks at once, using the same attack roll.

action.name: Thorn Whip
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 25ft., one target. *Hit*  22 ({@dice 4d8 + 4}) slashing and 7 ({@dice 1d6 + 4})

trait.name: Rocky Back
entries: While the Rock Crab does not move, it is indistiguishable from a normal rock.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock Throw
entries: Range Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit, the target must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Rock Pillars
entries: Within 80 ft. of the crab up to 3 solid pillars of stone shoot up from the ground. The Pillar is 50 ft.(1 percentile dice) high. All creatures in the space of the pillars must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take  18 ({@dice 4d8}) magical bludgeoning damage or half as much on a successful one. Additionally a creature who fails its save is knocked {@condition prone} on top of the pillar while a creature who succeded can choose a space 5ft. away to stand now. If no souch space is available the creatures save counts as failed.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn 't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 13}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The muk's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save dc 13). It can innatley cast the following spells requiring no components: 5/day any: stinking cloud, acid arrow (at level 5), bane (at level 5)

trait.name: Amorpheus
entries: The muk can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Poison Touch
entries: Whenever the Muk does a successful melee attack, the target has to make a {@dc 12} constitution savin throw, on a failed save, the target is {@condition poisoned} for 10 minutes.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Whenever someone enters within 5ft of the muk, he has to make a dc 10 constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 round

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 5({@dice 2d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Acid Spit
entries: {@atk rw} +7 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}The Target has to make a {@dc 15} Dexterity Saving throw, taking 21({@dice 6d6}) acid damage on a failed save and half as mouch on a successful one.

trait.name: Omnipresent
entries: The Cherry Tree can not be surprised or flanked.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If its counterpart in the other plane still exists, a destroyed tree regrows in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within the same space, where its counterpart in the other plane is placed.

trait.name: Strong Roots
entries: Every creature {@condition grappled} by the tree takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage at the beginning of each of the trees turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Cherry Tree can make three attacks per turn. Each action can be used multiple times.

action.name: Blossom Projectiles
entries: Range Weapon Attack. +5 to hit, range 100/200 ft., one target. *Hit* 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sweat Scent
entries: All creatures within 30 ft. of the Tree make a {@dc 13} wisdom saving throw, or be {@condition charmed} for 5 hours. If a creature that is already Charmed fails a saving throw for this attack again, it falls to sleep. A sleeping creature is {@condition incapacitated} and knocked {@condition prone}, it can be awoken by using one action. Also if the creature is attacked, it can make a {@dc 13} wisdom save to wake up.

action.name: Root Grip
entries: Two Creatures within 60ft. of the Tree must Make a {@dc 13} dexterity saving throw, or be {@condition grappled} by it.

legendary.name: Earthquake
entries: All creatures within 60 ft. of the tree must Make a {@dc 13} dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and beeing knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save. On a successful safe, the creature only takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}. Creatures {@condition grappled} by the tree automaticaly fail this safe.

legendary.name: Blossom Rain
entries: The tree makes a Blossom Projectile attack.

legendary.name: Pollen Explosion (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The tree releases defensive pollen that knock out enemys. It can only use this reaction if it's Hit Points are below half. Every Creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} wisdom saving throw or have their hit points reduced to 0 and fall unconcious. On a successful save, the creature takes 8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) psychic damage and, if on the trees next turn, is still within 30 feet of it, falls unconcious.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Ifil fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Devastating Tremor
entries: Every time that Ifil moves, each creature that is within 60 feet of it and standing on the ground must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Ifil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Ifil's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Ifil deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Death Smog
entries: Ifil secretes death smog from its body. Every 10 feet Ifil moves, it leaves this smog in a unoccupied 5-foot area. Each creature that enters the area or starts its turn in that area must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, or take 20 ({@damage 8d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ifil can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes four attacks: two with its claws and two with its stomps.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +19 to hit, reach 15ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} +19 to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}40 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ominous Pulse
entries: Each creature within 120 feet of it and standing on the ground must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they take 40 ({@damage 10d6}) force damage and are knocked {@condition prone}; those that succeed only take half as much damage and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Revive Dead
entries: Each creature that is dead within 120 feet of it that is not a Plant, Ooze or Construct is resurected as an undead without their Multiattack, Tags and Legendary Actions/Resistances. The revived creatures serve Ifil and do everything to protect him.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of Ifil's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if Ifil is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Ifil's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Frightful Counter
entries: Any time Ifil is targeted by a non magical melee attack, Ifil can use it's reaction to be unaffected, and half the damage that is dealt is returned to the original attack source. Ifil then follows up with one fist attack on the attacker.

reaction.name: Deadly Blood
entries: Any time Ifil is targeted by a melee attack, Ifil can use it's reaction to spray some of its blood in a 10 ft. radius around the attacker. Anyone in that area takes 10 ({@damage 1d20}) Acid damage and 20 ({@damage 8d4}) Necrotic Damage.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Ifil moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Ifil makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Tail Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Ifil flings its tails around. Each creature within 15 feet of Ifil must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or take 20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each non-undead creature within 20 feet of Ifil must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Lot's of Heroe
entries: While the Heroic Battle has more than half of it's hit points, it can attack every Creature within range once per turn.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The heroic battle can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the heroic battle can move through any opening large enough for a medium humanoid. The heroic battle can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

action.name: Melee Weapon Attack
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, range 0 ft., one target in the heroic battle's space. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d4 + 6}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, or 8 ({@dice 2d4 + 3}) if the heroic battle has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Ranged Weapon Attack
entries: {@atk rw} +3 to hit, range 20/40 ft., {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) bludgeoning or piercing damage, or 5 ({@dice 2d4}) if the heroic battle has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Magic AOE
entries: One creature within the Heroic Battle has to make a {@dc 13} DEX saving throw or take {@dice 4d4} fire, cold, thunder lighting, acid or poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Magic Attack
entries: {@atk rw} +3 to hit, range 20/40 ft., {@h}10 ({@dice 4d4}) fire, cold, thunder lighting, acid or poison damage, or 5 ({@dice 2d4}) if the heroic battle has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Trip
entries: One creature within the Heroic Battle has to make a {@dc 14} DEX or STR saving throw (Creatures Choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take {@damage 2d4} bludgeoning damage or half as much on a successful save.

trait.name: Liquid Courage
entries: Recharge 5-6). As a bonus action, the tavern brawl imbibes nearby alcohol to gain access to a hidden reservoir of audacity and grit. The tavern brawl gains 7 ({@dice 2d6}) temporary hp for 1 minute.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The tavern brawl can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the tavern brawl can move through any opening large enough for a medium humanoid. Except for Liquid Courage, the tavern brawl can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tavern brawl makes weapon attacks.

action.name: Chair
entries: {@atk mw} +4 to hit, range 0 ft., one target in the tavern brawl's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@dice 2d4 + 2}) if the tavern brawl has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Broken Bottles
entries: {@atk mw} +3 to hit, range 0 ft., one target in the tavern brawl's space. {@h}17 ({@damage 6d4 + 2}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@dice 3d4 + 1}) if the tavern brawl has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Flying Debris
entries: {@atk rw} +3 to hit, range 20/40 ft., {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@dice 2d4}) if the tavern brawl has half its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Slippery Fella
entries: Herpes is unaffected by difficult terrain and his movement can't be reduced in any way.

trait.name: Hi. Bye
entries: At the beginning of it's fourth turn, Herpes will disapear completly, exclaiming that he will be back when he is needed most.

trait.name: No Touchy
entries: When another creature touches Herpes, it needs to make a {@dc 15} Con Saving throw or contract a random desease from the table below ({@dice 1d10}). The deasese Lasts for 30 days or can be healed by anything that can heal diseases.
1 : {@disease Gambling Addiction|BMHS}
2 : {@disease Hydrophobia|BMHS}
3 : {@disease Tapeworm|BMHS}
4 : {@disease The Common Cold|BMHS}
5 : {@disease The Wariness|BMHS}
6 : {@disease Tetanus|BMHS}
7 : {@disease Soft Bones|BMHS}
8 : {@disease Polychromia|BMHS}
9 : {@disease Capilincrum|BMHS}
0 : {@disease Ligma|BMHS}

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Herpes makes 3 attacks.

action.name: Lil Nibble
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. *Hit* 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage and the target touches Herpes.

action.name: Rolling Alround
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. *Hit* The target Takes {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage for every rollout Herpes made in sequence and touches Herpes. Additionaly a creature that is medium or smaller has to make a {@dc 10} Con save or fall {@condition prone}.

action.name: Charge Attack
entries: The worm moves up to 40ft. in a straight line towards a target. It makes a Bite attack against any creature in it's path and the target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the wormling, and it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the wormling's turns.

If the wormling takes 10 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Acid Cloud
entries: The worm spits on a point within 60 ft. and in a 10ft. Radius a cloud of acidic gas appears. Every creature in range has to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spiderling can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spiderling knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spiderling ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Froststrin
entries: {@atk rw} +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage and it's movement speed is reduced by 10 ft. until the end of it's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Spiderling Sac
entries: When the Frostsilk spider is reduced below half of it's Hit Points, up to 4 {@creature Frostsilk Spiderling|BMHS|Frostsilk Spiderlings} Crawl out of her onto free spaces within 5 ft. of her.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Frostsilk Spider makes one Bite attack and two Froststring Attacks or replaces one of the Froststring attacks with a Frostweb.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 8 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Frostweb {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} +10 to hit, range 60/120 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the creature takes 20 ({@damage 6d6}) cold damage at the start of each of its turns. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 15} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 12; hp 10; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, cold, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Froststring
entries: {@atk rw} +10 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target takes 13 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage and 6 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and it's movement speed is reduced by 15 ft. until the end of it's next turn.

trait.name: Angry
entries: If the Beast takes more than 15 damage in one attack all creatures inside its cage are expelled onto a free space around the Beast.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Beast makes one claw attack and one grab or cuddle attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Grab
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one medium or smaler creature. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}).

action.name: Cuddle
entries: Choose 1 creature that the Beast is grappling The beast pulls it into its cage. While inside the cage any creature is {@condition restrained} and takes the same damage as the beast except for psychic damage and damage that is caused from inside the cage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The revenant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the revenant takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the revenant's next turn. The revenant's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The revenant is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Vengeful Tracker
entries: The revenant knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and the revenant are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by the revenant dies, the revenant knows.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes two shot attacks.

action.name: Shot
entries: {@atk rw} +7 to hit, reach 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature against which the revenant has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Vengeful Glare
entries: The revenant targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition paralyzed} until the revenant deals damage to it, or until the end of the revenant's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is {@condition frightened} of the revenant for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the revenant, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success.

Psionics

{@b Charges:} 18 {@b • Recharge:} {@dice 1d8} {@b • Fracture:} 21

trait.name: Feedback Aura
entries: Each time the dragon takes damage, all creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or else take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic or fire damage (your choice).

trait.name: Planar Travel
entries: Obsidian dragons have the innate ability to pass instantly between the Material Plane and the Inner Planes, where they often make their homes.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage plus ({@dice 2d6})fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 ft. of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 63 ({@damage 18d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detec
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Psionics
entries: The dragon uses a {@filter psionic ability|optionalfeatures|feature type=Psi. Man.}.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Shift (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon releases a wave of telekinetic energy from its mind. Every creature within 15 feet must make a {@dc 24} Intelligence saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) force damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon then can move up to half its movement speed.

trait.name: Worms
entries: If the Autophage is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, it withers away.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Autophage makes two attacks with its claws and uses Burrowing Worm or uses two Burroring Worms.

action.name: Burrowing Worm
entries: A worm launches from the Autophage at one humanoid that the Autophage can see within 10 feet of it.

The worm latches onto the target's skin unless the target succeeds on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. The worm is a Tiny monstrosity with AC 6, l hit point, a 2 (-4) in every ability score, and a speed of 1 foot. While on the target's skin, the worm can be killed by normal means or scraped off using an action (the spawn can use this action to launch a scraped-off worm at a humanoid it can see within 10 feet of the worm). Otherwise, the worm burrows under the target's skin at the end of the target's next turn, dealing 1 piercing damage to it. At the end of each of its turns thereafter, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage per worm infesting it (maximum of {@dice 10d6}). A worm-in-

fested target dies if it drops to O hit points, then rises 10 minutes later as an Autophage. If a worm-infested creature is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 (l{@dice d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scorpion makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its sting.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}). The scorpion has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 3d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Reaction

action.name: Feed
entries: When a creature within 40 feet of the Scorpion dies, it can run to the position and capture the soul of the creature, to add to its collection. Also, the Scorpion can choose to start feeding on the corpse gaining 7 ({@dice 2d6}) HP. If the Scorpion chooses to feed He is {@condition restrained} until the end of it's next turn.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 +the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point in stead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The zombie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fowl Appearance
entries: While the creature remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal chicken.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. The soul inhabits another creature within 30 feet ({@dc 20} Cha saving throw). While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The revenant is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Enormous Nose
entries: This creature gains advantage on any check involving putting things in its nose.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Psyonic Beam
entries: The revenant targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it.The target must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) Psychic Damage.

monster.name: Ceramics Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Berserk
entries: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 30 hp or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, usually an object smaller than itself. When the golem attacks while in Berserk mode, his Chipping abillity triggers. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to attack until it is destroyed or it regains all its hp.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The ceramics golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ceramics golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The ceramics golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Chipping
entries: Whenever the golem takes damage, he sprays ceramic chippings around him. All creatures within 5 ft. of the golem have to make a {@dc 14} Dexterity Saving throw or Take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing Damage not exceding the damage that caused this abillity to trigger.

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: A golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two attacks.

action.name: Pumble
entries: Melee Weapon Attack:{@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Chip Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

feat.name: Blessing of the Raven Queen
entries: You grow black Raven wings.

You gain the ability to sprout a pair of raven wings from your back, gaining a flying speed equal to your current speed. You can create these wings as a bonus action on your turn. They last until you dismiss them as a bonus action on your turn or until you fall unconcious.
You can use this ability once per Long Rest.

spell.name: Bupp's Beast Bombing

components.m: the cured body of a tiny beast

entries: You prime up to 5 tiny beasts within range with necrotic energy and a death wish. The creatures gain the following two abbilities:
{@i Death Leap}. As a reaction the creature can turn an attack that missed it into a hit.

{@i Necrotic Body}. When the creature is reduced to 0 hp, it explodes with necrotic energy in a 5-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (against your spellsave DC), taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
You can't control the creatures, but they will act in a way to hit the most possible people with their Necrotic Body Abbility, but will never intentionally hit you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th Level or higher, you can prime 1 more tiny beast for every level above 3rd.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Psyternative
entries: If you use ink worth atleast 1 gp, wich the spell consumes, as additional material, the damage of this spell changes to psychic, additionally you can prime the beast with up to 10 words. Anyone failing their save hears these words in their head.

spell.name: Equivalent Retrieve
entries: You can switch the position of two items, that are non magical. You have to hold one of the items and it has to be worth more or equal to the other item; and you have to have touched the other item before. If one ore both of the items are held or worn by another person, the person can choose to make a strength saving throw. On a successful save this spell does nothing.

spell.name: Be Me

components.m: two silver rings worth 100GP each, which the spell consumes

entries: You and a willing creature, that you touch switch conciousness. The switched creatures just take their memory and character with them. A swaped creature can do anything the body and mind could before the switch. After 1 hour, the switched people have to be within 120 feet of each other, or the switch is permanent. (can be reversed by casting it again and failing this requirement again.)

spell.name: Punish Magic

components.m: a mithril needle worth atleast 250 gp

entries: Choose any creature, object, or magical Effect within range. One spell of your choice of 3rd Level or lower on the target ends. For a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your Spellcasting Ability. The DC equals 12 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends. If the spell ends, the creature who cast the spell takes {@damage 2d8} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th Level or higher, you automatically end the Effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used minus two.

When you choose this monastic tradition at 3rd level, you become proficient in the Athletics and Performance skills if you do not already have them. The nature of your Unarmored Defense changes. While wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier. Your Ki save DC also changes:

subclassFeature.name: Keeping the fight alive
entries: Your mystical touch can heal wounds so that no battle shall be boring. Starting at 3rd level, you have a pool of magical healing power that replenishes when you take a long rest. With that pool, you can restore a total number of hit points equal to your monk level × your monk die. As an action, you can touch a creature and draw power from the pool to restore a number of hit points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in the pool. When you use your Flurry of Blows, you can replace one of the unarmed strikes with a use of this feature. This feature has no effect on undead and constructs.

subclassFeature.name: Strong Fingers
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can shove or grapple a creature instead of making an unarmed strike with attacks made as a part of your Flurry of Blows.

subclassFeature.name: Signature Move
entries: Beginning at 6th level, on your turn when you make an unarmed strike, you can declare you are performing your signature move. If you hit, the attack deals additional damage equal to two of your Martial Arts Dice. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier and they replenish after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sleeper Hold
entries: At 11th level, you can put a creature you are grappling into a sleeper hold. As an action, you expend 2 to 6 ki points. Roll 5d8, plus an additional 1d8 for each ki point in excess of 2 you spend. If the creature has fewer hit points than the total of your roll, it falls unconscious for 1 minute. Constructs, undead and other creatures that do not need to breathe or are immune to being charmed aren’t affected by your sleeper hold.

subclassFeature.name: Twirling Grapple
entries: Also at 11th level, if you are attacked while you are grappling a creature equal to your size or larger, you can spend 3 ki points to use your reaction to position the creature advantageously to you. You gain the benefits of three-quarters cover (+5 AC). If the attack misses you, but the attack roll is higher than the Armor Class of the creature you are grappling, that creature becomes the target of the incoming attack instead.

subclassFeature.name: Mucho Macho Combo
entries: At 17th level, you gain the ability to make a devastating flying suplex against a creature you are grappling. When you finish a Flurry of Blows and are grappling a creature, you can spend 1-9 additional ki points to making a flying suplex with one creature you are grappling. Upon impact, the creature you are grappling takes 2d10 force damage per ki point spent.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Strength, Dexterity and, Constitution scores increase by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Drosera reach adulthood at around 15 years and live up to 150 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most drosera are evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Drosera average about 6 feet tall and weigh about 100 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: You have a movement speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Headplate Vision
entries: While your headplates are unhinged, you can see in darkness within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light. However, you can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray. While your headplates are closed, they obscure your vision considerably: you require bright light to see further than 15 feet away from you, and are only able to see to a distance of 60 feet even with the aid of it. You can hinge or unhinge the headplates that form your jaw using your bonus action. When your jaw is unhinged, your sensitive eyes and mouth are exposed. If you are subject to a critical hit while your jaw is unhinged, the attack deals an additional {@damage 1d10} damage.

entries.name: Carnivorous Bite
entries: While your headplates are unhinged, you can use your fearsome jaw to make melee attacks that deal {@damage 1d6} piercing damage plus additional acid damage equal to twice your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Ambush Hunter
entries: You are proficient with longbows, spears, and the Stealth skill.

entries.name: Mutable
entries: When you reach 3rd level, You can caste the {@spell Snare|XGE|} spell once without any material components. You must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell Alter Self} spell once, and must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and plant.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial.

At first glance, a drosera’s head looks like a large, ripe melon. In truth, is made of two (or in a few tribes, three or even four) thick, interlocked toothed plates which, when opened, expose their mouth and a pair of eyes. This under-visage can be disturbing to other races, and so most traveling Drosera keep their plates closed, wearing fanciful wooden or ceramic masks in a vague mockery of most races’ facial structure. They have a set of air-holes on their necks that allow them to speak and breathe while their headplates are closed. Drosera prefer to eat meat to the exclusion of anything else, and they train their saplings in the art of the ambush from a young age. As they age, they take on more dangerous game with their sires, passing their skills down to the next generation. Finding work in civilized areas where their cannibalistic nature is not frowned upon is difficult, so drosera who leave their native jungles gravitate toward assassination work that allows them to take the lives (or limbs) of others.

entries.name: Drosera Names
entries: The drosera don't use traditional names between themself. The name is not something you have forever. Rather it is more like a Title which changes by feats or tasks. The individual is not as important as the part he takes in drosera society. Drosera who deal with other races often adopt names of the people they deal with, plants, or simple concepts.

entries.name: Male Names
entries: Glaemir, Bryn, Columbine, Del, Eldon, Erky, Mandrake, Solar, Vega, Red, Blue, Azule, Mandarin, Oak, Birch, Bark

entries.name: Female Names
entries: Breena, Carlin, Drusilia, Enna, Keyleth, Rose, Venus, Lux, Flora, Red, Blue, Azule, Ivy, Rosemary, Lily, Thorn, Umbra

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Alseid reach maturity by the age of 20. They can live well beyond 100 years, but it is unknown just how old they can become.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Alseid are generally chaotic neutral, though variations are common, particularly among those rare few who leave their people.

entries.name: Size
entries: Alseid stand over 6 feet tall and weigh around 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Alseid are fast for their size, with a base speed of 40 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Alseid Weapon Training.
entries: You are proficient with shortbows and spears.

entries.name: Light Hooves
entries: You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.

entries.name: Quadruped
entries: The mundane details of the structures of humanoids can present considerable obstacles for you, such as ladders and manholes.

entries.name: Woodfriend
entries: When in a forest, you leave no tracks and can automatically discern true north.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and fey.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

Alseid are graceful woodland cousins to centaurs, blending the torsos of elves with the lower bodies of nimble deer. Because they rarely venture far from their wooded glades, some call them “grove nymphs,” although they’re more closely related to elves than nymphs.
Alseid see the forest as an individual and a friend. They are suspicious of outsiders who do not share this view.

Lost travelers who demonstrate deep respect for the forest may spot a distant alseid’s white tail and chase after it as it bounces toward a road that leads out of the forest. Disrespectful strangers may follow the same tail to their doom.

entries.name: Branching Crowns
entries: Alseid have antlers growing from their foreheads. Antlers grow very slowly, branching every 10 years for the first century of life (so an alseid with six points per antler should be between 60 and 70 years old). Further points only develop with the blessing of the forest. No 14-point imperial alseid are known to exist, but many tribes are governed by princes with 13 points, indicating that they’ve done a great service to the forest on at least three occasions. Because antlers signify status, alseid don’t fight with them the way deer do. Cutting an alseid’s antlers is one of the direst punishments an alseid can receive. Elf rangers sometimes report seeing lone alseid exiles, wandering the forest, their antlers sawn off near the scalp.

entries.name: Ancient Magic and Nature's Champions
entries: Alseid have a deep connection with the old fey magic of the forest. Their leaders favor the druid and ranger classes, and wild magic sorcerers arise from deep forest glades infused with energy from the fey realms.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Draugr don't realy age, they stay at the age where their transformation took place

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Draugr are generally neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Draugr are human sized. You are Medium size.

entries.name: Speed
entries: You have a movement speed of 30ft.

entries.name: Dimvision.
entries: You can see in dim light within 30 feet of you as if it were bright light, and darkness as if it were dim light.

entries.name: Draugr Resilience.
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance to poison and necrotic damage.

entries.name: Memento Mori
entries: You are proficient in the History skill.

entries.name: Hard to Kill
entries: If you are reduced to 0 hit Points, you can make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead. If the damage was necrotic, you succeed your saving throw automatically. You can use this ability twice, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and undead.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one language of your choice.

Draugr are not a race, nor are they fully undead, although they are often mistaken for such creatures. “Draugr” is a common nomenclature for people of any race who share a semi-necrotic condition that increases their lifespans seemingly indefinitely. This condition appears when too much necrotic energy enters a humanoids body. A person inflicted has gray skin and hair and shows first signes of decay. Some manage to hold on to their Horns or other protusions while others lose them.

entries.name: Servants of the Dead Queen
entries: The first occurence of Draugr are widely acceptet to be the Draugr that resultet from the calamity that turned the land of Rehal into the Dead Zone. Many of the people who live in that land were transformed and are still serving their undead queen.

entries.name: Draugr Names
entries: Many Draugr keep their original name, but some see their transformation as a new life and thus choose a new name for themself.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Nychterids reach physical maturity at the age of 15, and can live up to 80 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Nychterids are usually of neutral alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Nychterids are between 3 and 4 feet tall, and weigh an average of 35 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: You have a base walking speed of 20 feet.

entries.name: Flight
entries: Your leathery wings grant you a flying speed of 30 feet. If you can attain a firm grasp, you can suspend your body from your feet without the need to make an ability check. You can’t fly or suspend yourself if you are wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Echolocation
entries: As an action, you emit a short burst of high-pitched noise, audible up to 60 feet away, but perceptible only to bats, other nychterids, creatures with a keen hearing trait, or creatures with a passive Perception of 17 or higher. Until the end of your next turn, you have a blindsense to a distance of 30 feet.

entries.name: Keen Hearing
entries: You have advantage on checks you make with the Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) skills that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Nychterid Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against disease.

entries.name: Speak with Bats
entries: You can communicate with bats as if you shared a language.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Gourmand
entries: You are proficient with cook’s utensils.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Nychterid. Nychterid is a chittering language, involving many sounds at higher frequencies than most folk can hear.

entries.name: Nocturnal Sharers
entries: Nychterids are a race of sapient batfolk. They make their colonies in caves or large hollowed-out trees, preferring to live in forests or jungles. Most nychterid colonies have two locations, and like bats, make an annual migration between the two to stay with favorable weather and the availability of their preferred foods.

Nychterids are famously private as individuals, except within others of their colony. Most nychterids live in a commune of 2-6 other nychterids. No matter what a nychterid’s other vocation in life, within their communes, they share everything: living quarters, domestic labor, food, sexual partners and child-rearing responsibilities. Nychterids derive their surnames from their commune, which are chosen among its members, and can change when a new member is accepted into it. Nychterid children are given the surname of their birth commune until they join another.

This desire for relative insulation from others suits most nychterids just fine, as their resemblance to bats inspires a seemingly primal fear in folk, and they are often discriminated against, being thought to be harbingers of plague or disease, or the agents of vampires. This is, of course, ridiculous, and most nychterids maintain a diet of fruit and insects.

Everyone in nychterid society takes their turn in the kitchen, so most nychterids are gourmands. If a one has invited you to their home and prepared for you a meal, you know you have made a friend for life.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Strength score increases by 2, your intelligence score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kabuto live protected lives inside their strong shells, and live long as a result. They reach full size in 6 years, and they live just past their second century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The Kabuto prefer highly structured lives, tending to be lawful neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: The largest Kabuto stand at about 5 and one half feet tall, and average around 350 pounds. However some only reach 4 feet in height, and are much smaller in stature. Regardless, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Concise Study
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks when attempting to find information through reading text.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Due to your shell and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your exoskeleton however grants you an AC of 17. Even though you can't wear armor, you still can use shields.

entries.name: Sylvan Spellcasting
entries: You know the {@spell thunderclap} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell shield} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level you can cast the {@spell shatter} spell as a 2md level spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and fey.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

Never in all my years had I seen such a beautiful sight as Kioko's Vault. Knowledge beyond our wildest dreams stored away forever, protected by our bravest Kabuto. I knew I had to persue a lifelong career here, especially after the librarians told me I had to in order to read the books.

A brute race of beetle-folk, the Kabuto use their physical strength to protect their highest value, knowledge. Other Humanoids dare not step into Kabuto territory, for its well known that their punishment is the harshest in all of Hokin.

entries.name: Powerful and Proud
entries: Kabuto are sturdily built with a chitinous beetle shell around their whole body. They stand hunched over, usually averaging at around 5 feet tall. But their makeup is dense, and often weigh around 350 pounds. They have long curled appendages, and often sport various styles of horns, but their lack of flexibility makes it unrealistic to use them in combat. Their eyes mirror light slightly with a blue, green, or yellow tints. Their shells are most often anywhere from brown and grey to blue and green. Some very rarely have vibrant patterns of many different colors.

entries.name: Practiced Intelligence
entries: Kabuto are addicted to collecting knowledge. Many Kabuto societies are built around grandious libraries. These societies rarely let others in as most other races cannot be trusted to treat their property with the same respect as they do.

The children are taught from a very young age to respect law and tradition, Kabuto do their best to regulate the world around them to follow their personal codes, but they often must accept the chaos of the outside world and adapt to it, despite their hatred for change. Their fervant respect of order, however, rarely blinds their logical judgement, and opinions are respected if put forth in a dignified and educated way.

entries.name: Kabuto Names
entries: The Kabuto's rigid structure is reflected in their process for naming their young. They reuse historically significant names to inspire traditional values in the children. The names are often of old Kabuto officials, heroes, or folklore. They do not have traditional families so they only have singular names.

entries.name: Names
entries: Aoi, Chihiro, Fuyuko, Hibiki, Jun, Kaede, Kyou, Masami, Noriko, Rin, Shiori, Tenzin, Tomomi, Yasu, Yoshi

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Young witchknives grow slowly. They reach full size after 30 years but are not considered adults until the age of 50. On average, they live about 250 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most witchknives lean towards neutrality. While some fall on either side of true neutrality, most focus on protecting and maintaining their families over the worries of the larger world. Other races often misinterpret the witchknife's abilities and assume ill intent where it may not exist.

entries.name: Size
entries: Witchknives stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average 120 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet. Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Recognize Language
entries: You have advantage on inteligence checks to recognize writen or spoken languages, that you can't speak or read.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Psionic Command
entries: You know the {@spell message} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell command} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Undercommon, and two extra languages of your choice. Witchknives are driven to learn a variety of languages, for their psionic commands are only obeyed by creatures that can understand them.

"By the Gods!" the cloaked human muttered under his breath as he was compelled to plunge into the cold, stagnant waters of the cistern. The rest of the tavern goers, who came out to watch, cackled with glee as the loudmouthed man burst back out of the brown waters, gasping for foul smelling air. The small humanoid he had confronted, stubby red horns atop his head and forming a rough goatee on his chin, grinned proudly before slipping into the crowd and disappearing.

Legend tells of a time when when all creatures spoke one language and athames ruled the world. Their word was law, and other creatures obeyed any command the athames gave. Then a deity interfered and taught the athames' subjects to speak new languages. This broke the athames' power over them and the subjects, who feared and hated the athames despite their magnanimous rule, rebelled and tore the athame empire to pieces.

entries.name: Thick Bodied
entries: Witchknives have tough skin that ranges in color from dark gray and brown to ruddy orange. They have short, red horns in places where other creatures have hair and their eyes are orange or yellow with red pupils. Their blocky frames rarely exceed 5 feet in height and average 120 pounds.

entries.name: Enclaves
entries: Witchknives live in small enclaves, with rarely more than two hundred adults, hidden away from the civilizations of other races. These enclaves have a hierarchy of rank determined by birth, but most witchknives are of equal rank and have many rights and privileges. Most witchknives live in a monastic manner inside fortresslike homes, spending their days meditating, training for combat, and learning.

entries.name: Natural Psionicists
entries: Witchknife is the name other creatures use to refer to the athames because of their power to compel victims to do their bidding with but a single utterance. A witchknife's psionic ability to command others relies on the target creature being able to understand the witchknife, which leads witchknives to seek out and learn as many languages as possible. This is the driving force for any witchknife who leaves the confines of their enclave.

entries.name: Witchknife Names
entries: Witchknives are given nicknames upon their birth, generally describing the color tone their skin takes. Once a witchknife reaches adulthood, they select a new name for themselves, generally combining it with their nickname. There is little distinction between male and female names and witchknives never assume a surname; choosing instead to use the name of their enclave.

entries.name: Nicknames
entries: Amber, Ash, Black, Bone, Coal, Ember, Flint, Grey, Iron, Onyx, Rose, Steel

entries.name: Adult Names
entries: Amberaxe, Ashblade, Blackrock, Bonechin, Coalheart, Emberfist, Flintcutter, Greyfox, Ironback

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ikiwi reach maturity at 10 years, and live up to 60 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Ikiwi tend toward neutral alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Ikiwi average 2-3 feet tall, and weigh around 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet. If both of your hands are unoccupied, you can run on all fours at a speed of 35 feet.

entries.name: Keen Sight
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made that rely on sight.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Leverage
entries: You can wield weapons with the heavy property without the penalty usually applied to small creatures.

entries.name: Owlbear Talons
entries: You have sharp talons, which grant you a climbing speed of 20 feet. In addition, your claws and beak are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Patterned Feathers
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when you attempt to hide in snowy terrain.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and monstrosity.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write, Common and iki.

entries.name: Instinct, Evolved
entries: Ikiwi resemble bipedal owls with no wings and short, talon-fingered hands. Some suspect they are descendants of the first owlbears, or part of the same set of experiments that created them. They are short, stocky and share the enhanced musculature of their larger cousins.

Ikiwi prefer to live in mountains and boreal forests, and are capable hunters. A few even live in the most barren of deserts. Rarely farmers, ikiwi consider it a point of pride to hunt their own dinner.

Ikiwi mate for life as a general rule, and their families rarely exceed four individuals at a time. If a family grows too large, the eldest child is encouraged to leave the nest and start their own family. Leaving the nest marks adulthood in their lives, and their parents make a great display, showering gifts and well-wishes upon their departing child, or throwing a party attended by friends and even extended family.
Although ikiwi are typically shy, cautious, and generally slow to trust others, they make steadfast friends and trustworthy allies.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2 and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Quagsir are hatched as an armless, larval form called a Woopy. They mature within 2 years, growing arms and achieving their adult Quagsir form. Once matured, a Quagsir can live as long as 25 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Quagsir generally keep to themselves, preferring neutral alignments. Their oblivious, self-serving nature quashes any interest they may have in the struggle between law and chaos.

entries.name: Size
entries: Quagsir usually stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and weigh between 150 and 200 lbs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet, and you have a swimming speed of 25 feet.

entries.name: Amphibious.
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Iron Tail.
entries: Your thick, club-like tail acts as a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Damp.
entries: Your thick skin and swampy habitat have made your body a natural shock absorber. You are resistant to lightning damage.

entries.name: Ice Beam.
entries: You know the Ray of Frost cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and elemental.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Aquan.
These froglike creatures make their home in the elemental plane of water, they live in small communes and do simple jobs. They don't care much for the larger politics.

entries.name: Biology
entries: Quagsir are light blue, bipedal, amphibious Humanoids. Their heads are broad and round, having little neck to distinguish it from the rest of their bodys. They have a wide mouth and tiny, black eyes. A wavy, purple stripe runs down their back. Along their spine is a dark blue fin, which is larger on the males than on the females. Quagsir's hands and feet both have three digits. Their outer layer of skin is slimy and slippery.

entries.name: Unaware Waterdwellers
entries: Quagsir are carefree and sluggish by nature. These lazy creatures tend to bump their heads inadvertently while swimming on their back and seem not to care or be hurt in any way. They sometimes just lay still in the water, leaving their mouths open and waiting for fresh fish to enter.

entries.name: Quagsir Names
entries: Quagsir don't realy care for names. They change what they are called related to who they are talking to. Most adventuring Quagsir choose a nickname others gave them as theirs.

language.name: Nychterid
entries: Nychterid is a chittering language, involving many sounds at higher frequencies than most folk can hear.

language.name: Iki
entries: Iki is a language of clicks, caws, and whistles and does not have its own written language. Most ikiwi write in Common or in pictographs.
